original_title: Irate parents turn to legal action over the marketing of so-called ‘toddler milks’ | CNN
article_summary: "Toddler milks" marketed as a necessary nutritional step for toddlers, but critics argue they are not nutritionally necessary, may contribute to childhood obesity, and are not regulated like infant formula. Experts recommend cow's milk as a cheaper and nutritionally adequate alternative for most toddlers over 12 months.</s>
